column3:
FIRST YEAR PROGRAMME IN DESIGN + ARCHITECTURE FOR STUDENTS FROM THE PEOPLES REPUBLIC OF CHINA

The Glasgow School of Art (GSA) and the Central Academy of Fine Arts in Beijing, (CAFA), have joined to provide a unique opportunity for students from the People's Republic of China - a pathway to a UK university degree beginning in Beijing and completing in Scotland. GSA/CAFA - a first year programme in Design and Architectural Design.

Students spend the first year at the Central Academy of Fine Arts undertaking a
programme in Design or Architectural Design. The programme is designed by The Glasgow School of Art, and students also benefit from the excellent academic environment, facilities, and reputation of the Central Academy. On successful completion of the year, students transfer to Scotland and specialise in Architecture (BArch) or in one of a range of Design subjects (BA (Hons) Design).

The First Year Programme in Beijing is studio based, with supporting studies in the history and theory of architecture and design, and English language. English tuition, provided by professional language teachers and integrated into the academic curriculum, forms 20% of the programme, ensuring that students are well prepared for study in Scotland.

A formal partnership with a professional visa service also provides the best attention to ensuring success.

Students of this unique programme will benefit from significant advantages. First and foremost, they will have experienced what we believe to be one of the best practice-based creative educations in architecture or design available world-wide.

The programme is conducted in English and, by acquiring the ability to communicate fluently in English - the language of international culture and business - students will gain access to professional design and architecture networks in Europe and the English-speaking world. In studying a UK degree, with its internationally highly-regarded status, students acquire an international perspective, which enhances their professional skills and standing as a designer or architect, and offers excellent career and employment opportunities in China and abroad.

CONTACT INFORMATION
For more information, please visit
www.gsa.ac.uk/chinaprogramme or contact:
GSA: Raz Barfield Programme Coordinator
r.barfield@gsa.ac.uk
CAFA: Dr Wang Qijun Programme Coordinator
qijunwang2001@yahoo.com.cn
CAFA: Huang Li Programme Administrator (CAFA)
huangli@cafa.edu.cn
